result.execSummary:
The defendant Leamon Hannah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit a DNA sample; pay surcharge; all other court costs WAIVED due to restitution owed by the defendant. Pay the DNA surcharge and restitution by payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with first payment due on 11-15-15 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and convert to a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leamon Hannah

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Richard M. G. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26214308 in court 2x on 7/27/15, 10/12/15.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Leamon Hannah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Leamon Hannah in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.   Amended Information submitted.   Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waived its reading.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  

 Charge amended to COUNT 1:  ENDANGERING SAFETY BY USE OF A DANGEROUS WEAPON , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 941.20(1)(a), 939.51 (3)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor

 Negotiations set forth by the state.   The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court orders the defendant to serve 203 days with credit for 202 days.  The Court finds this to be a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  The Court orders the defendant to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge; all other court costs WAIVED due to restitution owed by the defendant.  The Court orders restitution in the amount of $2194.44 payable to Wisconsin Southern Railroad.  The Court orders payment plan for dna surcharge and restitution in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 11-15-15 and additional payments due the 15th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and convert to a civil judgment.  Defendant advised of appeal rights. Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing APRIL 9, 2015 received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to ATTORNEY MATTHEW LAMKE  819 N. 6TH STREET 9TH FLOOR    MILWAUKEE, WI 53203

Defendant Leamon Hannah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Leamon Hannah in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for Ron Dague for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Final pretrial conference held.  Defendant is ready to proceed to jury trial.  Case remains calendared for jury trial in Branch 19 on 10/12/2015 at 9:00 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Leamon Hannah not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing. Parties have not reached a resolution. Final pretrial and jury trial dates were set. Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Leamon Hannah not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leamon Hannah in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Leamon Hannah in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Spingola-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leamon Hannah in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Leamon Hannah in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
